trans-unit.source: Represents a database foreign-key field that is used by ASP.NET Dynamic Data.
In ASP.NET Dynamic Data applications, the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn> class represents a database column that denotes a one-to-one relationship.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn> class represents the column in the table that contains the foreign-key field.
However, you can access the parent table object by using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ParentTable%2A> property.
You can determine if the foreign-key field is a primary key in the table that contains it by using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn"></xref> class.
The entity meta table.
The entity column provider.
Saves the value of a foreign key in the specified dictionary.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ExtractForeignKey%2A> method is used to save the value of a foreign key in the dictionary that contains all the new values for a data field.

Typically, the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ExtractForeignKey%2A> method is used when a new value is selected from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control for the foreign key field.
A dictionary object that contains the new values for a data field.
The value of the foreign key.
Gets a collection that contains the names of the foreign keys in the association that represents a database relationship.
A collection that contains the names of the foreign keys.
Returns the alternate name that is mapped to a foreign key.
This method returns the alternate name that is used in a filtering expression instead of the actual foreign-key name.
If an alternate name does not exist, the method returns the actual name of the foreign key.
The name of the foreign key.
The alternate name that is mapped to the foreign key.
Gets the path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyDetailsPath%2A> method returns the path for the details action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application.
This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.

Using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyDetailsPath%2A> method is the same as invoking the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method passing the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction.Details%2A> action as the first parameter.
The row that contains the foreign-key field.
The path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method returns the path for the specified action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application.
This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.
You can use the values defined in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction> class for the `action` parameter.
The target action.
The row that contains the foreign-key field.
The path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method returns the path for the specified action page based on the specified `path`.
This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.
You can use the values defined in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction> class for the `action` parameter.
The target action.
The row that contains the foreign-key field.
The target page.
The path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
Retrieves a comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign-key for the specified row.

The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyString%2A> method returns the same values that are returned by the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyValues%2A> method, but in a different format.
The row to retrieve the foreign-key values for.
A comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign key for the specified row.
Retrieves a collection of values that represent the foreign keys for the specified row.

The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyValues%2A> method returns the same values that are returned by the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyString%2A> method, but in a different format.
The row to retrieve the foreign-key values for.
A collection of values that represent the foreign keys for the specified row.
Initializes data that may not be available when the constructor is called.
This method cannot be called directly.
To customize initialization, you can derive from this class and override the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.Initialize%2A> method.
If you override this method, call the base control's `Initialize` method.
Gets a value that indicates whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table.
Use the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable%2A> property to determine whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table.
This is the table that contains the foreign-key field not the parent table.
`true` if the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the parent table of the foreign-key field.
The parent table of the foreign-key field.
